title: Dodge Garage
summary: Integrating Sanity.io for DGs events involved defining and building structured content, migrating old data, and defining new workflows so that account managers can take ownership of the process
comment: Taking work off of the development teams' shoulders

additionalImages.comment: Code sample from Dodgegarage schema for Sanity Dashboard
additionalImages.altText: Sanity.io events dashboard for dodge garage
additionalImages.description: The first step in the process was defining the schemas for the events in Sanity. This required setting up form elements so that a user could can fill out a form(below) for each event. Leveraging Sanity's predefined types made this a generally straightforward process.

additionalImages.altText: Sanity.io events dashboard for dodge garage
additionalImages.description: This dashboard streamlined content management by providing a easy to use interface that allowed content editors control over their work. The benefits of the transition were the complete removal of day‑to‑day content operations of the dev team on behalf of account managers, minimal maintenance work for developers, reduced turn‑around‑time on client requests, and allowed the development team to concentrate on higher-level projects.

additionalImages.altText: Sanity.io events dashboard for dodge garage
additionalImages.description: This dashboard streamlined content management by providing a user-centric interface that allows content creators control over their work. This autonomy has eliminated the need for developer intervention in day-to-day content operations, reducing maintenance workload and enabling the development team to concentrate on higher-level projects.

additionalImages.comment: Accessibly details view using WAVE chrome extension
additionalImages.altText: Sanity.io events dashboard for dodge garage
additionalImages.description: This dashboard streamlined content management by providing a user-centric interface that allows content creators control over their work.
